cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Florence is drifting west-northwest, forecast to move slowly west across extreme SE North Carolina and NE South Carolina today, then curve west-southwest tonight, before turning north over the western Carolinas and into the central Appalachians early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Storm Surge Watch) and Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds (Hurricane Warning); South Santee River SC to Duck NC (Storm Surge Warning); Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts focused on North Carolina and northern South Carolina coasts; secondary effects possible along the Georgia coast from swells and outer rainbands.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (25-35 mph) possible in outer rainbands late Saturday into Sunday; sustained tropical-storm winds remain unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (1â€“2 ft) or enhanced high-tide levels possible due to persistent on-shore swell, but major surge is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1-3 inches of rain; localized higher pockets possible but totals should stay below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf along Georgia beaches; brief squalls could reduce visibility for harbor operations.
